company_description:
Owkin exists to find the right treatment for every patient. Our focus is to use artificial intelligence to discover and develop better treatments for unmet medical needs, starting with the fight against cancer.

In November, Owkin became a ‚Äòunicorn‚Äô - a startup worth more than $1 billion - through a $180 million investment from pharmaceutical company Sanofi. As a result, we are now looking for the brightest and best talent to help us to go even further in achieving our mission.
job_description:
Job description
About us

Owkin is an AI biotechnology company that uses AI to find the right treatment for every patient. We combine the best of human and artificial intelligence to answer the research questions shared by biopharma and academic researchers. By closing the translational gap between complex biology and new treatments, we bring new diagnostics and drugs to patients sooner.

Owkin has raised over $300 million and became a unicorn through investments from leading biopharma companies (Sanofi and BMS) and venture funds (Fidelity, GV and BPI, among others).

Owkin is seeking the best and brightest to join our fast-growing and dynamic team.

About the role:

You will join the Data Ops team.

As a Data Steward, your role is to establish a harmonized data management practice, specifically to manage data expectation, data quality and delivery for internal and external projects, with the assistance of external experts when required.

You will also coordinate internal and external data throughout the whole life cycle (governance, curation, processing, standardization, integration) and support the OWKIN teams to provide insights on models and standardization

In particular, you will:
Formalize the requirements into Data Dictionary and specification to collect data for data to address the research question by supporting R&D & Medical teams
Support Partnership teams to conduct Data Hunt and Contractualization
Oversee that the right people receive the appropriate data when required
Contribute to the Feasibility Assessment including evaluation of the work effort for CRA (Clinical Research Associate)
Establish processes to best manage data through the use of different standardization tools such as data models or standard terminologies, health data exchange protocols
Maintain agreed-upon data definitions and formats and ensure that end-users adhere to the specified data standards
Identify data quality issues by searching and properly evaluating sources of information to determine possible limitations in reliability or usability
Prepare detailed reports for management and other departments by analyzing and interpreting data
Collaborate with project management for data delivery to ensure all projects can start in the timely manner, following phases of the implementation lifecycle using FAIR approach and classical project management lifecycle
Manage external suppliers CROs (Contract Research Organizations) and outsourced resources (Clinical Research Associates, Data Managers, Data Engineers) for specific projects
Contribute to the growth and the maintenance of the Owkin's Data Catalog on a transversal layer as well as maintain internal data knowledge to answer RFPs (Request For Proposals) and by providing support to commercial teams on topics related to data (questions, studies‚Ä¶)
Contribute to better data documentation providing support to the redaction of Data Management SOPs, Data Management Plan, de-identification processes
Ensure compliance to GDPR and regulatory (e.g. GCPs)

The responsibilities missions described are not an exhaustive list; additional tasks may be assigned or the scope of the job may change as necessitated by business demands.

Position is based in our Paris or Nantes offices or remotely.

About you

Required qualifications / experience:

Bachelor's degree in life sciences, biostatistics, data management or related field
Strong transversal medical knowledge
Experience with multimodal health data, data management, data governance, interoperability standards, multi-stakeholder projects
Knowledge in FAIR principles
Past experience with both academic and private collaborators
Knowledge of healthcare information systems and main softwares & tools
Ability to complete milestones and work toward multiple deadlines simultaneously
Ability to summarize theoretical concepts in a clear vision for non-technical interlocutors
Excellent multitasking skills and task management strategies
Interpersonal and customer service skills
Ability to use necessary databases and softwares
Experience working with private and sensitive personal information
Able to compile and organize statistical information retrieved and present findings to management
Fluent in two languages, one of which must be English
What we offer
Competitive salary & excellent benefits package
Flexible work organization and access to remote work
Friendly and informal working environment
Opportunity to work with an international team with high technical and scientific backgrounds
Recruitment Process & Security
Please attach a CV.
Owkin is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, gender, sexual orientation, age, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status or on the basis of disability.
Owkin is a great place to work. Unfortunately, being a coveted workplace means we are vulnerable to recruitment phishing scams. We urge all job seekers and candidates to be wary of potential scams. Most of these have individuals posing as representatives of prominent companies, including Owkin, with the aim of obtaining personal, sensitive, or financial information from applicants. These scams prey upon an individual‚Äôs desire to obtain a job and can sometimes ‚Äúfeel‚Äù like a genuine recruitment process. Some red flags are identified below. Should you encounter a recruitment process that claims to be for Owkin but is not consistent with the below, please do not provide any personal or financial information:
Legitimate Owkin recruitment processes include communication with candidates through recognized professional networks, such as LinkedIn. However, further
communication is always through an official Owkin email address (from the @owkin.com domain), over the phone or though Recruitment platforms (WelcomeKit, talent.io, hidden.market, Fifty Talent or Hiresweet);
Legitimate Owkin recruiters will not solicit personal data from candidates during the application phase including, but not limited to, date of birth, social security numbers, or bank account information;
Legitimate Owkin interviews may be conducted over the phone, in person, or via an approved enterprise videoconferencing service (such as Google Meets or Highfive). They will never occur via Signal, Telegram or Messenger
Legitimate Owkin offers of employment are based on merit and only extended once a candidate has interviewed with members of the hiring team. Offers will be extended both verbally and in written format. Owkin may request some personal information to initiate the hiring process, but this will be through protected means.

If you think that you have been a victim of fraud,

Check the identity of recruiters on LinkedIn and the website https://owkin.com/team/
Check the existence of the position on our website https://owkin.welcomekit.co/
Notify Owkin's recruitment unit at this address hiring@owkin.com
contact the following authorities:
[FR] https://www.internet-signalement.gouv.fr/
[UK] https://www.actionfraud.police.uk/reporting-fraud-and-cyber-crime
[US] https://www.ftccomplaintassistant.gov/#crnt&panel1-1

Experience with one or more data-visualisation tools (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, QuickSight etc.)

Comfortable working with large datasets and are able to write complex and performant queries.
Comfortable working in a fast moving environment, managing several topics in parallel with different stakeholders.
Strong analytical skills to identify patterns and insights, and to propose actionable recommendations.
Have a natural curiosity and investigative mindset.

We welcome collaborators with their diverse perspectives and experiences to power us forward. These often far exceed conventional job requirements and help us create a culture of continuous learning. If you‚Äôre ready to join a hyper-growth company at the heart of digital transformation for the world‚Äôs most forward-thinking organizations, we strongly encourage you to apply to any of our roles, even if you think you‚Äôre not an exact match.

job_description:
Job description
tl;dr
Wielding both "business" and "data" skills, you conduct projects from A to Z in order to transform our clients' businesses.
Our working language is English, but it's always easier when you speak the local language(s) ;)
¬†
The team

The backbone of our consulting missions, today our Data consulting team has more than 400 consultants covering all Artefact's offers (and more): data marketing, data governance, strategy consulting, product owner...

Manage projects as well as leading our business growth, the data consulting teams welcome all business and technical background joiners, who would thrive as an expert in a specific field, or a true versatile player.

¬†
Mission

As a data consultant, you will be conducting projects from A to Z to accompany the transformation of our clients‚Äô businesses.

It will be up to you and the team will be defining the clients' needs, and the strategy or the solution to be implemented to solve their problem and meet their objectives. You will manage the implementation project of said solutions, sometimes by good old sliding, sometimes by writing a few lines of SQL codes, if you are up to it!

You will be a representative of Artefact in business proposals, but also a contributor to our business-relevant contents. The potentials are endless.

¬†

Desirable skills

In this fast-paced, fast-growing industry, the most important qualities in our eyes are intellectual curiosity, autonomy and dynamism.

You weild both ‚Äúbusiness‚Äù and ‚Äúdata‚Äù knowledge, with experience ideally in a digital marketing consulting firm; You already have a first understanding of digital technologies, and care to develop more in the exciting world of data and digital business

Why should you join us
Artefact is the place to be: come and build the future of data and marketing

Come join us!

company_description: Founded in 2005, Dailymotion is a global video platform built on a clever player and intuitive algorithm connecting over 350 million users to their personal news and entertainment space. It is also the player used by 90% of French media. So, for example, watching videos on Le Monde, Konbini, or Being Sport happens via their player technology. Today, 9 of 10 French internet users watch qualitative content in their ecosystem daily, making them the first French player. Dailymotion is part of the Vivendi media group with headquarters in Paris and offices in New York, Singapore, Montpellier, and Sophia Antipolis.
job_description:
Job description

Our team context:

Dailymotion is seeking a Junior Data Engineer to join the Data tribe. Our tribe is responsible for all the Data products at Dailymotion; your work will have an impact throughout Dailymotion‚Äôs business and help make data-driven decisions on products and strategy.

You will join a team of Data and Machine Learning engineers who have built Software that processes¬†hundreds of terabytes of data, billions of real-time events, hundreds of tasks automated by Airflow and millions of API calls every day. Multiple machine learning projects including recommender systems, semantic annotations, spam detection, and fraud detection.

What we will do together:

Our stack runs almost exclusively on Google Cloud Platform. You will work in an environment made up of Data Lakes (BigQuery, etc.), data streaming platforms (Beam / Dataflow, Flink, etc.), orchestration and scheduling platforms (Airflow), container-oriented deployment, and management platforms (Docker, K8S, Jenkins), SQL. You will also participate in data modeling activities and design of data flows until their implementation and support in production.

Additional Information

At Dailymotion, we empower candidates to take action. If this job sounds like a great opportunity for you, be confident in your skills, we are always happy to meet you! If needed, we can accommodate our recruitment process for your special abilities.

Location: Paris
Type of contract: Permanent¬†

Profil

Hardskills

REQUIS¬†:¬†Snowflake, Snowpipe,¬†devOps (Jenkins, Git), DBT and SQL, Fivetran (ou √©quivalent),¬†Python, Data Platforms (design et implementation),¬†Apache Kafka (ou platforme de streaming √©quivalente).
PLUS :¬†Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, Data Studio,¬†Tables delta, SGBDR traditionnel (SQL), NoSQL (MongoDB, DynamoDB, Cassandra, Neo4J, Titan), Docker, Kubernetes, Apache Airflow, API Rest,¬†BigQuery, AWS Redshift, Azure Synapse Analytics, Databricks,¬†Azure, AWS ou GCP.

company_description:
Equativ is a French AdTech offering an advertising monetization platform for the most important websites in the world.

Our objective‚ÄØ? Disrupt the digital advertising industry through high-performance solutions, innovative formats, and exceptional quality.

Based in the heart of Paris (IX·µâ), the company continues its international development around the world (opening of the Singapore office in 2019). We have been recognized in the ‚ÄúChampions de la Croissance‚Äù rankings by Les Echos and the‚ÄùFast 500 EMEA‚Äù by Deloitte.

Our pride? A team of over 500 employees who flourish through a corporate culture advocating ownership and who live through 3 essential values: Be brave, Be thoughtful, Be together.
job_description:
Job description

üë´ About the team

The ad tech industry is a super dynamic and innovative ecosystem where the competition between platforms is tough and the amount of collected data points is enormous. Thus innovation is key to our business, and that's our raison d'√™tre: our mission at the Analytics Lab is to explore new areas and harvest unexploited revenue potential from Equativ‚Äôs existing tech platform through A/B testing and advanced coding.¬†¬†

We do that by

‚Ä¢ providing exploratory analysis to identify revenue opportunities (research)¬†

‚Ä¢ A/B testing to generate revenue from those insights (production)

‚Ä¢ building our own pipeline to scale our tactics (engineering)

hand in hand with Product and R&D, ultimately paving the way for the next feature improvements in our platform.

While Analytics Operations' clients are mostly Equativ's collaborators, the Analytics Lab's client is Equativ's platform.

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre looking for both explorers and builders.¬†

Our tech stack : SQL, Python, Snowflake, Airflow, ClickHouse & more

Reporting to the Analytics Lab Team Lead, you will work in collaboration with various teams including Business, Product & R&D teams on strategic topics to improve our monetization platform in an iterative project life cycle.

What you'll do ‚úèÔ∏è

Operations - Run
Own our revenue generation activity - Ensure proper execution of the Analytics Lab automated pipeline streams & fix bugs: A/B tests deployment & analysis, results communication and implement successful pricing strategies
Guarantee our rigorous thinking - Contribute to fortifying our processes and ensure they are applied on a daily basis, from feature deployment sanity check to scoping and performance
Engineering - Automation
Industrialize our code - Contribute to improving the Analytics Lab pipeline streams at all levels with Python: sourcing, deployment, sanity check, analysis, communication
Research - Discovery
Explore new dimensions and metrics, assess their business value, present actionable insights to push for feature development into our product roadmap¬†
Investigate new strategies to detect pricing optimization areas and best associated pricing strategy to improve the monetization of our platform
Collaboration
Train, support, provide product updates and get feedback from local Business teams
Groom projects with Product, R&D and communicate achievements to a larger audience
Contribute to enriching the Analytics Lab‚Äôs documentation

About you üí™

You are available for a period of 6 months
Master‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative or business field (Statistics, Mathematics, Econometrics, Economics, Computer Science or any Engineering related field etc.)
Technical appetence and hands-on mindset is a must
Proficiency in SQL is a must. Proficiency in Python is a must.
Knowledge of collaboration platforms (Gitlab) is a plus.
Knowledge of reporting software (Tableau) is a plus.
You are fluent in English.
You can demonstrate your ability to solve problems end to end.
Ability to present results to both technical and non-technical audiences
Curious, daring, dynamic and versatile personality required.
You have a real interest in the online Advertising market and the impact of high-performance technology in this market.

Hiring Process

Call with our recruiter (15')
Technical test in SQL & Python (60')
Technical interview with the Analytics Lab Team Lead (60')
Culture interview with the Head of Analytics Operations (30')

Are you a business profile with a strong taste for coding?

Are you an engineer/dev with a strong business acumen?

Are you curious and bold? Then we need to talk ü§û

With the Analytics Lab, you will be able to grow both technically and from a business standpoint. You will be heard, and you will be challenged, all this in a very good mood -because having fun at work is key (after all we do it 5 days a week).

Strong work ethics + minimum proficiency level in SQL and Python required.

Equativ is part of the #FT120

üëã About us¬†

Equativ is the new single name for Smart Adserver, DynAdmic, LiquidM and Nowtilus ‚Äî four proven innovators in advertising technology. The vertically integrated company provides brand and privacy-safe solutions that empower its clients to achieve maximum impact while respecting the rights of consumers. The union combines client expertise and engineering excellence to serve the interests of both the supply- side and demand-side with equal professionalism and technical sophistication.

Headquartered in Paris and New York, Equativ operates globally with a team of more than 550 people in 20 offices. Equativ offers the market its own independent ad server, SSP, buyer tools, and media services to fulfill the promise of advertising technology. Learn more at Equativ.com.

Equativ (formerly Smart AdServer) has been awarded the HappyIndex@Work label and is proud to be among the best companies in the ChooseMyCompany ranking, recognized for its flexible working environment.

job_description:
Job description
We - Cafeyn Group

With more than 15 years of existence, Cafeyn Group is a multi-brand company composed of Cafeyn, Blendle, miLibris and Kidjo. Based in France, The Netherlands, UK, Canada and Morocco and with almost 200 employees, we propose an innovative media experience through different products. We want to achieve strong business performance across the Cafeyn Group through organic growth, diversified revenue streams and sustainable profitability. New opportunities are continuously sought by investment both within and outside of the business. We deliver high-value, high-focus and forward-thinking, premium infotainment (information & entertainment content) services to our partners and customers, with personalized and relevant content to entertain and educate our audience, broadening their perspective and making them more knowledgeable.

Your responsibilities:

You will be part of the Data Engineering team, within the Tech team.
Your focus will be on building, consolidating, and maintaining data pipelines,¬†ensuring efficient and effective data processing. Additionally, you will provide technical expertise and support to other data specialists, such as analysts and scientists, to assist them in their projects. Your contributions will also involve helping to develop the best possible tech architecture.

For instance, you will typically be asked to:¬†

Build ELT processes.

Help develop and maintain data services (endpoints, database etc.).

Administer our data warehouse (Snowflake) and enforce good practices.

Build cloud infrastructure components within our cloud provider AWS.

Contribute to building and improving the governance of our data.

You are at the right place if you have:

6 months to 2 years of experience in a similar role (internships/apprenticeships count!).

A first experience of development with Python.

A first experience with databases/SQL.

A first experience with Git or another version-control tool.

Fluent level in english.

It would be a plus if you have a first experience or general knowledge of one of those tools/languages:

Airflow, Snowflake, Terraform, AWS, Kubernetes or their equivalents.

It would be a perfect match if you have:

Very good interpersonal skills.

Good oral and written communication skills.

Good level in French and/or Dutch is a plus.

Hiring Process:

Upon applying, you can expect the following:

Screening with our TA Ludmila (45')
Interview with Rapha√´l, our Data Engineering Manager (1h)
Technical testat home.
Debrief & Interview with the team (1H30)
Fit interview with other data team members (1h)

¬†

You don‚Äôt have to match all the requirements, if you feel this offer could be a great opportunity for you, reach out anyways! We hire based on talent and we promote inclusivity inside Cafeyn and strongly believe that our culture is strongest when it is the most diverse.

Field8: Intelligence artificielle / Machine Learning, FinTech / InsurTech, SaaS / Cloud Services
company_description:
Qantev (www.qantev.com) is an artificial intelligence company that helps health insurers deliver better healthcare to their members.

We do that by leveraging their historical health claims data and by applying machine learning and optimization to predict patient journeys.

We are backed by top European investors and industry leaders, and have customers all across the world (Europe, USA, LATAM, Asia and the Middle East).

We are a growing team of talented, enthusiastic, and diverse professionals. As an early hire, you will have an unparalleled opportunity for ownership and growth within the company.
job_description:
Job description

Your role

As a member of the data science team, and working alongside our technical experts, you will be able to:

Understand health data and healthcare economy dynamics.
Improve our OCR pipeline deployed on insurance claims data.
Work on our NLP pipelines for medical coding inference and sentiment analysis on hospital reviews.
Enhance our fraud detection machine learning models.
Scale our proprietary patient journey optimizer based on state-of-the-art optimal transport.
Implement and optimize the associated algorithms.
Find and implement the best ways to test and deploy our machine learning models at scale.
Continuously provide ideas to improve the solution.
Integrate this in our awesome python/pytorch/react/postgresql/elasticsearch stack.
Field11:
Preferred experience

Your profile

Looking for a 4-6 months internship.

Advanced technical skills in Applied Mathematics, preferably in machine learning, probabilistic modeling, computer sciences and/or operations research.

Strong analysis with synthesis abilities, not afraid to deal with details.

Able to write quality production code.

Eager to meet clients to discuss their needs and integrate their feedback in your projects.

Fluent in English and Chinese (Mandarin).

Bonus skills

Working on production-grade projects with good software engineering insights.

Experience in deep learning and pytorch.

Previous startup experience or working within an agile framework.

Speaking Cantonese.

Mad foosball or table tennis skills (tables pending) and a good sense of humor.

Benefits of working at Qantev

Opportunity to join a challenging environment among top-notch engineers and experienced entrepreneurs.

Develop a deep understanding of the health insurance industry.

Take part in scaling a global tech start-up.

Work life: flexible hours & remote friendly.

Location: 10 rue Auber, 75009 Paris.

Competitive compensation.

Annual company off-site.

Start-up ecosystem benefits

Brand new Macbook

Alan Blue health insurance

Swile (daily lunch vouchers & gift cards)

Navigo reimbursement

company_description:
Si le gaspillage alimentaire √©tait un pays, il serait le 3√®me plus gros pollueur au monde.

C‚Äôest de ce constat qu‚Äôest n√© Too Good To Go pour proposer un outil simple permettant √† chacun de lutter contre le gaspillage alimentaire, √† son √©chelle, qu‚Äôon soit commer√ßant ou utilisateur.

Apr√®s seulement 6 ann√©es d‚Äôexistence, le mouvement Too Good To Go est dans 17 pays en Europe, au Canada et aux USA!

En France, l‚Äôapplication compte plus de 11,9 millions de t√©l√©chargements, plus de 32 000 partenaires et ensemble, ils ont sauv√© plus de 39 millions de repas !

Too Good To Go a un vrai r√¥le de sensibilisation sur le gaspillage alimentaire et a aujourd‚Äôhui l‚Äôambition d‚Äô√™tre une r√©elle autorit√© de lutte sur ce sujet.

Chez Too Good To Go, ils oeuvrent pour un monde avec du sens, o√π la nourriture produite est consomm√©e et ne finit pas tragiquement gaspill√©e.
job_description:
Job description

At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

More than 40% of all food produced in the world is wasted and retailers lose between 1-3% of their annual sales due to food waste, all of this waste has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.¬†

The Retail Technologies team are working on our new software solution that is used directly by Retailers to identify and manage their inventory before it becomes food waste and further extending our expertise and in-store solutions beyond our marketplace supporting stores in managing their unsold and surplus products.

We‚Äôre more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We are growing fast, with a community of 76 million users in 17 countries. Together, we have saved more than 218 million meals from going to waste since we started - but there‚Äôs still a lot more we want to achieve.
The Role

We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to be a part of our Product Teams that define, build and deliver our product features. Working in a product team means you will work towards specific outcomes with the freedom and responsibility to figure out the best route to achieve them together with the other Engineers and Product members of the Team.

Your mission will be to help refine, design, implement, deliver and maintain various product features. You will be one of several developers, working as part of a multidisciplinary team and will bring your knowledge and expertise to the table.¬†

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will actively support your engineering lead in delivering a quality, maintainable and international top-class product, whilst being a role model for less-senior team members, by taking responsibility for problems and using your expertise to identify the right solutions.¬†

The Tech Stack

We use SnowFlake for our data warehouse, DBT to define transformations and Airflow to orchestrate them. To visualise we currently use Redash but are migrating to Looker.

Responsibilities

Build and maintain our data infrastructure by:¬†

Collect and send this data to and from the appropriate place, we are obtain data from our partners but also from our app FoodMemo.

Aggregating raw data into precomputed tables for dashboards, we have two dashboards, one internal facing & one for our partners.

Create pipelines for our Machine Learning algorithms

Maintain our KPIs for internal dashboards

In other words, you will make sure that the wealth of data generated and collected is safe and efficiently accessible to those who need to use and understand it.

Participate in mentoring, and coaching whilst actively giving and encouraging regular feedback with those around you.

Be an inspirational member of the team, ensuring those around you follow and trust in your actions towards building the best long-term product

Be responsible by acting as an owner for problems which may arise, unless agreed upon by others, we will count on you to look at the bigger picture, even if this may fall outside of your usual day-to-day.

Think big, we want you to push your limits, and think outside of the box, addressing ways in which we can add scalability to our work.

Simplify things and break down what looks hard into smaller digestible pieces:

Spread your expertise

Distribute work¬†

Automate

Deliver on commitments and be accountable. This is your chance to #buildalegacy.

Actively participate in your teams‚Äô agile development processes, with a continuous improvement mindset‚Äù
Field11:
Preferred experience
The Ideal candidate

You are a senior, and with it have a wealth of experience as a data engineer

You know SQL perfectly and you also have experience with DBT.¬†

In addition, you know that the devil is in the detail and you enjoy looking for and fixing those small errors that can create inconsistencies.¬†

You enjoy working in a cross-functional team and exchanging with different stakeholders to understand their needs and build the best solution possible.¬†

What we offer

An opportunity to have a huge impact, knowing what you help design will be used daily by hundreds of thousands of store employees daily, enabling to save millions of food items per day.

This a rare opportunity to work in a global social impact company (and certified B Corporation!) where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.

An autonomous environment, with several opportunities to contribute, build on experience and take ownership of your work in a way that works for you.

A nice bunch of colleagues in the Paris office üôÇ (~100+ people) and beyond them 1,300+ colleagues across 17 countries that are on the same important mission.

Opportunity to influence our product, design and ways of working, every day.

An informal atmosphere, with a strong, values-driven team culture where we celebrate successes and socialise with colleagues that care to offer

Nous travaillons des bureaux les Lundis, Mardis et Jeudis

company_description:
Amazon Web Services (AWS) est la plateforme cloud la plus compl√®te et la plus largement adopt√©e au monde. Elle propose plus de 200 services complets issus de centres de donn√©es du monde entier.

job_description:
Job description

At Amazon we believe that every day is still day one. A day to take a first step. A day to look forwards to new challenges. Today is that day for you!
It's your day to be part of something great. A day to make your ideas come to life, to join a company that redefines itself every day. That's the energy and passion behind Amazon.

For our AWS data centers in the Paris area, we are looking for a Data Center Security Specialist (DSS).

Our ideal candidate is detail-oriented, organized, and innovative. They enjoy teamwork and looking for continuous improvement in security posture and processes.

This position is to be 80% operational and 20% tactical.
The DSS will support a senior Data Center Security Manager in charge of physical security operations in multiple Data Centers.
The DSS role will include the supervision of the contract guard force. They will conduct drills and tests, investigate alarms, and participate in daily operations from a security point of view, liaising with internal and external stakeholders.

Key job responsibilities


Coordinate day-to-day activities and site security operations
Coordinate with Operations and Safety managers for facility operations
Provide guidance and leadership to contract security provider personnel.
Evaluate the contract security provider performance and service delivery and request corrective actions from vendors as needed
Foster working relationships to educate data center stakeholders on false alarm reductions
Extract metrics and observe improvements by looking at and analyzing data
Verify Data Center security programs are delivered to meet defined global security standards
Assist in all media integrity related Programs
Assist in the training of new and existing personnel on behavioral compliance to security policies and procedures
Handle escalations and resolve tasks delegated and/or assigned to the team
Draft reports and prepare presentations on the status of physical security operations
Collaborate with managers in writing and implementing security policies, processes and procedures based on regional or global security initiatives.
Serve as a customer advocate by identifying security-related opportunities and crafting innovative solutions that maintain uncompromising security standards
Participate in site audits, inspections and walk-through
Identifying, discussing and bringing forward issues and solutions to senior team members
Field11:

Strong communication skills
Ability to learn and adapt quickly to company tools for data gathering and analysis
Metrics oriented
Ability to act swiftly and calmly in time of crisis
Ability to handle confidential information with care
Ability to integrate into an international work environment

company_description:
Yassir is the leading super App for on demand, ride-hailing, last-mile delivery, payment services and more, set to change the way daily services are provided. It currently operates in 45 cities across multiple countries. It has raised $150 million in Series B funding, five times what it raised in its previous priced round last November with world class investors such as BOND and Y Combinator, which is the precursor of the likes of Airbnb, Stripe, Dropbox, Doordash, among others.

We offer on-demand services such as ride-hailing and last-mile delivery. Building on this infrastructure, we are now introducing financial services to help our users pay, save and borrow digitally. Helping usher the continent into a digital economy era.

We‚Äôre not just about serving people - we‚Äôre about creating a marketplace to bring people what they need while infusing social values.
job_description:
Job description

About Yassir

Yassir is the leading super App for on demand, ride-hailing, last-mile delivery, payment services and more, set to change the way daily services are provided. It currently operates in 45 cities across multiple countries. It has raised $150 million in Series B funding, five times what it raised in its previous priced round last November with world class investors such as BOND and Y Combinator, which is the precursor of the likes of Airbnb, Stripe, Dropbox, Doordash, among others.¬†

We‚Äôre not just about serving people - we‚Äôre about creating a marketplace¬†to bring people what they need while infusing social values.

We are seeking an experienced and data-driven individual to join our team as a Data Analyst. The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of data analysis techniques and the ability to exploit databases in order to uncover insights hidden within large datasets.

As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with our AI team to conduct all necessary data studies prior to the launch of machine learning projects that cover all of our services. You will play a central role in communicating data-related topics within the company, with regular presentations to different stakeholders.

The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills. Additionally, you will have the ability to think creatively and "hack around" problems to uncover insights and the perseverance to solve problems that may not have obvious solutions. We value this kind of "out of the box" thinking and problem-solving abilities. If you are excited about the opportunity to make an impact in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, we want to hear from you!

About your role as Data Analyst

Translate business questions and strategies into clear, measurable outputs that provide impact to Yassir.
Design, create, and evaluate outputs, including metrics, definitions, dashboards, and apps.
Communicate actionable insights through effective data visualization and clear communication to support the company's strategic direction.
Extract meaningful insights from data, create light data pipelines if needed, and deliver results through dashboards, reports, or one-off analyses.
Perform statistical analysis on transactions and marketing data to provide reliable signals of the truth.
Design experiments and AB tests to promote data-driven decision making.
Serve as a sparring partner for the product team to help them define KPIs and recurring reports to measure the performance of their initiatives.

Requirements - Must Have

You have 3+ years of professional experience working as a data analyst
Excellent command of SQL (Postgres, Standard SQL, having worked with BigQuery is a plus) and statistical software languages (R or Python)
Good understanding of statistics (sampling, distributions, probability theory, experiment design, regression etc.)
Good knowledge of machine learning techniques and data pre-processing
Advanced English communication skills
Willingness to both teach others and learn new techniques.

*As a company, we are passionate about diversity and inclusion, 40% of our team are¬†women¬†leaders in the tech sector. Research shows that women do not apply for jobs if they do not meet all of the requirements.¬†We would like to hear from you if you feel you would be a good fit for us!

PS: And if you want to stand out in your application, just let us know in your cover letter why we should have in our team. üí°

Diversity & Inclusion & Engagement:¬†

We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, as we believe diverse teams are more successful in the long term. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, and we encourage all people equally to apply for jobs with us.

company_description:
Kyriba is the world leader in proactive cash management. Their mission is to enable CFOs to be more agile and efficient in managing their cash flow and liquidity. Its SaaS Treasury and Risk solutions enable clients to optimize their cash flow, manage their risks and manage their capital.

Kyriba was established in 2000 and has more than 700 employees, serving more than
2,000 customers worldwide. Kyriba, headquartered in San Diego, also has offices in New York, Paris, London, Tokyo, Singapore, Hong Kong, Rio de Janeiro and Shanghai.

In March 2019, Kyriba raised $ 160 million to intensify innovation and accelerate the growth of its platform.
job_description:
Job description

Kyriba¬†is the global leader in Proactive Treasury Management. Our SaaS treasury and risk solutions enable finance teams to optimize their cash, manage their risk, and work their capital.¬†

Our award-winning cash, treasury, payment, risk management and supply chain finance solutions are used by more than 1 300 leading organizations worldwide, including Amway, Electronic Arts, PulteGroup, and Qualcomm, to unlock new business value, drive growth and ensure compliance.
Kyriba was established in 2000 and has over 700 employees, serving more than 2 000 clients worldwide. Headquartered in San Diego, Kyriba also has offices in New York, Minsk, Paris, London, Tokyo, Hong Kong and Rio de Janeiro.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Kyriba is seeking a talented Cloud Data engineer to join our team of more than 200 engineers working together to bring innovative solutions to Kyriba clients around the globe. We are a team of passionate people motivated by agility, innovation and continuous improvement.


As a Cloud Data Engineer with at least five years of experience in Data Operation, you will be in charge of managing, improving and scaling our data pipelines. The ideal candidate will have previously shown the ability to design, implement and maintain new and existing databases, data pipelines and data warehouses, Additionally, experienced in monitoring, alerting, trending and dashboarding of data metrics. The Cloud Data Engineer works closely with Cloud Engineering Operations, Product Developers, Product Owners and Customer Support on new architecture and feature introductions.



RESPONSIBILITIES

Create, maintain and execute on improvements to our data pipeline and databases as we scale our systems to meet customer demand

Enhance and extend database, data pipeline and data warehouse performance and scalability

Identify relevant business metrics and implement real time monitoring, alerting, trending and dashboarding.

Analyze and communicate data and database problems

Participate in performance and load test efforts

Assist in creation and maintenance of the test data environments and test data

Respond to non production and production incidents on a rotating basis

Rotating 2nd Level on call with a team of 3-4

Implement customer facing Service Requests involving data processing


SKILLS

B.S. Degree in Computer Science or related field

2+ years' experience in Data Warehousing/Data Lakes (Redshift Classic/Spectrum, DataBricks preferred)

2+ years' Experience developing infra-as-code (Hashicorp, Terraform, or equivalent)

2+ years' Experience with Docker, Kubernetes (or container orchestration equivalent)

3+ years' Experience with AWS, GCP , and developing CI/CD tooling

3+ years' experience with RDBMs (Postgres, Oracle)

2+ years' experience with data pipeline technologies (kinesis, EMR, kafka(MSK))

3+ years' experience with Linux

3+ years' with AWS dbs and data stores

3+ years' with observability, monitoring and alerting tools (DataDog, SumoLogic, Cloudwatch, Opsgenie preferred)

Experience with data migrations from one data platform to another

Experience working in an Agile environment

Experience with automating data and db deployments/upgrades (Liquibase preferred)

Experience with Bitbucket/Jira/Confluence

Understanding of web technologies, including web services, web application servers and RESTful APIs

Experience working in a 24X7X365 SaaS environment

Experience with HIPAA/PHI/GDPR data security and privacy

English is the working language.¬†

Basic experience with NoSQL (DynamoDB, MongoDB preferred) is a plus

Basic understanding of Finance and Treasury Management is a plus

company_description:
BlaBlaCar is the world‚Äôs leading long-distance carpooling platform ‚Äì a global, trusted community of 100 million members in 22 countries. BlaBlaCar is creating an entirely new, people-powered, travel network that connects people looking to travel long distances with drivers heading the same way, so they can travel together and share the cost. With the recent integration of a coach bus network, and a commuter service for short-distance carpooling, BlaBlaCar aims to become the go-to marketplace for shared mobility.

With a dedicated member relations service, a state of the art web and mobile platform, novel insurance solutions and a fast-growing community, BlaBlaCar is making travel social, cost-effective and practical for millions of members. BlaBlaCar is continuously innovating, developing smart-stop and smart-pricing algorithms that dynamically unlock millions of possible local meeting points and, in effect, turn every highway into a major transport line while also allowing for more granular point-to-point service in less accessible areas. By doubling the number of people in cars (from 1,9 to 3,9 people), BlaBlaCar saved 1.6 million tonnes of CO2 in 2018 (the equivalent of traffic in Paris for a year).
job_description:
Job description

We are looking for a Confirmed Data Engineer to join the Data BlaBlaCar Daily squad. Our Data services are organized following Data Mesh principles, distributing data ownership to domain-specific teams that manage, own, and serve the data as a product.¬†

The Data BlaBlaCar Daily squad is in charge of the data products related to BlaBlaCar Daily members and customers. BlaBlaCar Daily creates a unique commuting product; it connects passengers and drivers on their home-work journeys. The squad builds a data warehouse on this scope to serve clean data to BlaBlaCar Daily customers, which includes both internal users (Product, Engineering, Sales, Customer Success) and external customers (local governments, enterprises).

The squad benefits from the support of the whole BlaBlaCar technical ecosystem, while operating as a nimbler start-up. The data-warehouse is built around two main components: Google BigQuery and Airflow.

Your role is to build the foundations of the data warehouse layer. This layer integrates work from BlaBlaCar and Klaxit, following the recent acquisition. It needs to be taken to the next level, supporting 10x more use cases as it did before. You will work closely with Data Analysts, Data Scientists and Software Engineers on your team to continuously provide data products to internal and external clients.

Also, you will contribute to the Data Engineering Chapter, a horizontal group of Data Engineers, whose mission is to improve tools for Data Engineers, and make efficient the day-to-day of a Data Engineer by innovative technologies, processes etc.

Your Responsibilities

As a Data Engineer, you'll be working closely with Floriane Duccini, Engineering Manager of the squad, as well as 3 Data Analysts. During the first months, your main role with the team will be to centralise and unify all Data from BlaBlaCar Daily and Klaxit.

You'll be responsible for:

‚Ä¢ Building efficient and robust data models for large volumes of data

‚Ä¢ Developing and optimizing the data workflows from the raw layer to the data mart in our data platform

‚Ä¢ Implementing solutions to improve the data quality

‚Ä¢ Being the point of communication for all Data Engineering decisions in your domain; working closely with the Data Analysts of your team

‚Ä¢ Contributing in the Data Engineering Chapter, defining policies and standards for data management

‚Ä¢ Articulating the strategy to build a data platform; this platform enables a mesh of autonomous data domains to interoperate.

Your Qualifications

‚Ä¢ You have strong data engineering skills and are used to working hand-in-hand with data consumers on a daily basis

‚Ä¢ You have strong SQL skills & work experience on a cloud data warehouse

‚Ä¢ You have strong experience with Python, including testing, deployment and codebase refactoring

‚Ä¢ Ideally, you have Engineering Analytics experience (working with DataMarts)

‚Ä¢ You have excellent communication skills, you‚Äôre humble, and you enjoy sharing & learning from others

‚Ä¢ You embrace change, are able to take a step back, prioritize, and focus on added-value tasks

‚Ä¢ You have a results-driven and impact-oriented mindset

‚Ä¢ Fluency in English

If you don‚Äôt meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you‚Äôd still be a great fit for this role in your application!

What we have to offer

üåé An international environment with over 45+ nationalities

‚öñÔ∏è A hybrid, flexible workplace with family-friendly policies

üí° Learning opportunities via access to training, mentorship, internal development programs, or our weekly team-all BlaBlaTalks and Tech & Product Demos

ü§ù Team-building events like our weekly afterworks, breakfasts, our annual Coding Night or Impact Day

üå± A product and a workplace with a strong commitment to sustainability

üß≠ Shared BlaBlaPrinciples that are the foundation of our culture and everyday decisionsTo know more, check out our 100 reasons to join BlaBlaCar!

Your Future Benefits

‚Ä¢ Full remote possible in the country of the role

‚Ä¢ 1 additional month parental leave 100% paid

‚Ä¢ Financial support for home office equipment

‚Ä¢ Relocation package and visa support

‚Ä¢ Free unlimited carpooling & bus rides

‚Ä¢ Employee Stock Ownership plan

‚Ä¢ Minimum 25 days holiday per year

‚Ä¢ Local meal plan policies (Swile card in France)

‚Ä¢ 50% transportation paid in France (Forfait Mobilit√© Durable)

‚Ä¢ Mental health support through Moka.care

Interested in joining the ride?

Here‚Äôs what your hiring journey will look like:

‚Ä¢ a 45-min video-call with our Talent Acquisition Manager, Benjamin R√©my, to get to know you, understand your career expectations, and answer your questions

‚Ä¢ a 60-min video-call with your future manager, Floriane Duccini, to get to know you and present you the team

‚Ä¢ a fully remote exercice to evaluate your technical skills

‚Ä¢ a 60-min video-call with Software and Data Engineers to discuss your exercice and technical skills

‚Ä¢ a 45-min video-call with Emmanuel Martin-Chave, VP Data¬†to assess your growth mindset

Usually, our hiring process lasts on average 20-25 days and offers usually come within 48 hours.

BlaBlaCar is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

job_title: Senior Data Analyst -  Growth & Customer Engagement
company_description: BackMarket is the number one European (and soon global) marketplace specializing in the sale of fully refurbished tech devices.
job_description:
Job description

Back Market is the world‚Äôs leading refurbished electronics marketplace with a team of 700 people, powering operations in 17 countries (and counting!).

Named one of the World's Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company in 2019 and again in 2021, our mission is simple: empowering people to consume tech sustainably by offering folks a high quality, accessible, and more eco-friendly alternative to buying new electronics.¬†Why? Refurbished tech helps lower our collective environmental impact. We have indeed contributed to avoid the production of more than 1,000,000‚ÄØtons of CO2e worldwide since our launch in 2014.

Be part of an exciting and growing international adventure that will change the way the world consumes tech.

As a senior data analyst, you will be part of our Analytics & Insight team supporting marketing and country general managers to drive growth and customer engagement.

YOUR MISSION (IF YOU ACCEPT IT): üèÖ

Conduct deep dive analysis on our sales performance in our top countries across dimensions (pricing, demand, competition ‚Ä¶) to identify growth opportunities¬†
Conduct deep dive analysis on our client long term value (LTV) to identify and monitor the high value actions in which we should invest in to drive customer engagement in the long term
Analyze & monitor our client services performance (insurance, new batteries ‚Ä¶) to optimize our offers and better serve our customers
Be an active contributor to the strategy, by thinking beyond immediate analysis to understand the long-term implications of actions
Collaborate closely with business & top management : supporting their needs, sharing your analysis & recommendations in an impactful way to get their buy-in

YOU ARE IN THE RIGHT PLACE IF: ‚≠ê

5-8+ years of relevant industry experience (ecommerce, retail, marketplace‚Ä¶)
You possess a good balance of statistical/technical skills, business acumen, and communication skills
Experience partnering with internal teams to drive action and providing expertise and direction on analytics
Strong knowledge of SQL, Python is a plus
Experience in marketplaces and growth are a plus

RECRUITMENT PROCESS: üìÖ

Interview with Julien, Talent Acquisition Manager
Tech Interview with two Senior Data Analyst from the Marketplace Analytics Team
Team Fit interview with Christophe, Head of Analytics & Insights
Final Back Market Values fit interview

WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US ? ‚úåüèº

- A meaningful job: you will help avoid thousands of tons of electronic waste and fight against planned obsolescence. It counts!

- A meaningful company: we became a mission-driven company in January 2022.

- Be part of a worldwide growing company based in Europe, the USA and Asia to face great challenges : you will have the freedom to innovate and adopt new ideas!

- Work alongside passionate experts:¬† who will share their knowledge and help you develop and grow in your career.¬†

- Grow your career: with a flexible career path and a dedicated Learning & Development team. Back Market will help you evolve with personalized internal trainings and external handpicked providers from day 1!

- Leadership Academy by Back Market:‚Äúbe a coach not a dictator‚Äù is at the core of this program ! We train and enable all our leaders to support their team towards achieving goals. Be a manager at Back Market is an unique experience we take by heart.

- An attractive salary, equity and a host of benefits including : Lunch voucher, health insurance, relocation package, paid time off for activism in your community, parental benefits, flexible hours, etc‚Ä¶

- Remote friendly company : up to 3 days of remote work per week!

- One Loving Tribe: you will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced, open-minded and friendly environment.¬†

- Be part of one of our Employee Resource Groups createdaround shared identities, common backgrounds and/or special interests crafted to be a safe space and an expressive outlet.¬†

- Several internal events: The Monday Brief (weekly)/ The Somehands (monthly)/ The All Hands (annual).

- We‚Äôre here to SABOTAGE: It‚Äôs our mantra. It keeps us focused on what we aspire to be: a little bit sneaky, always smart, kinda frugal and constantly conspiring to create maximum impact.

Back Market is an Equal Opportunity Employer which means we pledge to not discriminate against employees based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetic information.. If reasonable accommodations are needed for the interview process, please do not hesitate to discuss this with the Talent Acquisition Team.

Back Market is helping to address one of the biggest challenges of our time: climate change. We take this so seriously that we were awarded status as a ‚ÄúSoci√©t√© √† Mission‚Äù, or company with a social mission, by the French government. We know we can‚Äôt tackle a global problem without a globally representative team so we are committed to embedding diversity, equity and inclusion principles in every aspect of our organization. But more importantly, being One Loving & Free Spirited Tribe is in our DNA as it is one of the five foundational values of our company since we got started way back in 2014. We are committed to hiring and supporting diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We know our lofty goals cannot be reached unless everyone has a seat at the table along with the resources and opportunity to grow.

At Aqemia you will work in a multi-disciplinary team of passionate drug hunters, AI engineers and developers who are committed to our mission of finding many drugs, at high pace, to cure diseases.

As part of our growing team, you will enjoy a fast-paced, challenging, science-driven and creative environment, working at the very forefront of AI & Deep physics-powered drug discovery. You will also support engineering Teams to build their Data pipeline and assets. This way, you will be instrumental in all engineering teams‚Äô success.

10+ years experience in research at Ecole Normale Sup√©rieure in Paris, not to mention a stint in Oxford and Cambridge.

Our premises are conveniently located in center of Paris (1 Bd Pasteur), with a possibility of up to 2 days of remote work.

Aqemia is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, disability status or any other basis under applicable law.

Job description

Artefact is a new generation of data service provider, specialised in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing.

¬†

¬†

What you will be doing: Key responsibilities

Qualifications: Education & experience required

In addition, you have the knowledge in one or more of the following technologies:

ETL tool (Airflow, Dataiku, Dataflow, Dataprep...)¬†
Web application (R-Shiny, Python Flask) that you have industrialized

Ideally you have:¬†

Knowledge of statistics¬†
Knowledge of machine learning and data engineering
What we are looking for
A Doer:¬†you get things done and inspire your team to do the same
An Analyst:¬†you LOVE data and think every company should take their decisions based on facts
A Pragmatist:¬†you have a no-nonsense mindset that seeks for practical and realistic solutions
A Mentor:¬†your clients and colleagues naturally seek you out for advice

Why you should join us

Culture:¬†join the best team you could ever imagine
Entrepreneurship:¬†you will be joining a team of driven entrepreneurs. We won‚Äôt give up until we make a huge dent in this industry!
¬†
Come join us!

company_description:
At Alma, we are convinced that trade must be well balanced to be sustainable. Because finance has a key role in business, our mission is to put it back in its rightful place : at the service of merchants and consumers !

That‚Äôs why we create financial products that empower merchants to sell more, and help consumers purchase better products while never encouraging them to get over-indebted.

Our tech solutions are accessible to all, easy to implement, and that eliminate purchase friction.

For merchants, our instalment and deferred payment solutions are excellent ways of increasing customers‚Äô loyalty and satisfaction, as well as generating up to 20% extra sales revenues without any risk. and they generate an incomparable level of satisfaction with 64 Net Promoter Score.

For consumers, the purchase experience is enhanced (4.7/5 on Trustpilot) and Alma helps them handle their budget easily. They pay later, Alma pays the merchants right away.

We are the leader in France, on track to win the European market on the (very) powerful Buy Now Pay Later (BNPL) industry, as we‚Äôre now processing payments in 10 European countries. Over the past 5 years, more than 11 000 merchants have chosen Alma to be their innovative BNPL solution, and we have served over 2.7 million consumers.

The team has grown from 2 to 350+ people, we raised a ‚Ç¨210M series C early 2022 to help us accelerate further and Alma is already part of the Next40 ranking of the most promising French technology companies. And that‚Äôs only the beginning.

Part-time work possible (80%)

Descriptif du poste

Senior Claims Data Analyst (H/F)¬†

D√âCOUVREZ votre opportunit√©¬†

L'√©quipe que vous rejoindrez
Vous rejoindrez notre √©quipe Sinistres au sein de la Business Unit APAC Europe chez AXA XL.¬†
Le service au client est au c≈ìur de nos activit√©s. Le r√¥le des √©quipes Sinistres est de g√©rer les sinistres importants et complexes de nos entreprises clientes lorsqu'un sinistre survient, et nous conduisons le " moment de v√©rit√© " de l'assurance en tenant la promesse que nous avons faite lorsque nos clients ont sign√© leur contrat avec AXA XL. Ceci est reconnu par nos courtiers qui font r√©guli√®rement l'√©loge de la qualit√© de notre service sinistres, leader sur le march√© (par exemple, n¬∞2 en Europe dans l'enqu√™te Aon Voice for the Client H1 2022). Nous g√©rons un portefeuille d'environ 200 000 sinistres par le biais d'√©quipes locales, de deux centres de programmes mondiaux (Autriche et Hong Kong) et de deux centres de services partag√©s (Inde et Pologne). Nos polices couvrent plus de 30 branches d'activit√© et 14 pays, et elles sont souvent incluses dans des programmes couvrant plus de 200 pays.¬†
Au sein de l'√©quipe Sinistres APAC Europe, notre objectif est de (i) piloter la strat√©gie et la transformation de nos activit√©s en mati√®re de sinistres dans l'ensemble de nos zones g√©ographiques, (ii) soutenir les responsables des sinistres et leurs ~500 sp√©cialistes des sinistres pour g√©rer les sinistres de nos entreprises clientes (en particulier sur les op√©rations, les donn√©es et les analyses et le service √† la client√®le), et (iii) surveiller les sinistres et les activit√©s de traitement des sinistres, ainsi que les risques et les contr√¥les qui y sont li√©s. Pour ce faire, nous travaillons en √©troite collaboration sur les projets avec les responsables locaux des sinistres et leurs talents, ainsi qu'avec les centres d'excellence mondiaux des sinistres et les autres d√©partements de la Business Unit APAC Europe (souscription, conseil en risques, op√©rations et technologie, finances, gestion des clients et des courtiers, strat√©gie, gestion des risques, RH‚Ä¶). Notre √©quipe internationale cr√©√©e il y a 2 ans fonctionne avec des membres bas√©s √† Paris, Dublin, Madrid et Londres, et interagit avec des √©quipes √† travers le monde notamment aux Etats-Unis (si√®ge d'AXA XL).

Ce que vous ferez

Nous renfor√ßons notre √©quipe avec un(e) Senior Claims Data Analysts exceptionnel(le). Vous serez rattach√©(e) au responsable du service et de la transformation des sinistres, et vous aurez deux responsabilit√©s principales :

S√©curiser l'analyse de nos donn√©es sur une base mensuelle, trimestrielle et annuelle (au niveau APAC Europe et au niveau pays).
Nous pensons que nous devons am√©liorer de mani√®re significative la fa√ßon dont nous mesurons et analysons nos sinistres (pertes) et nos activit√©s de sinistres, notamment parce que la compr√©hension de notre portefeuille de sinistres et l'am√©lioration de nos op√©rations sont cruciales pour la rentabilit√© d'AXA XL.¬†
Pour y parvenir, votre r√¥le sera crucial :¬†
vous devrez remettre en question et analyser un ensemble de donn√©es, comprendre les moteurs de changement et traduire votre analyse en commentaires pertinents pour nos parties prenantes senior.¬†
Vous devrez comprendre en profondeur les sp√©cificit√©s et les r√©serves des indicateurs (d√©finitions, port√©e, calcul, y compris les objectifs), des syst√®mes de gestion des sinistres et des outils d'information g√©ographique. Pour √™tre pertinente, votre analyse reposera sur des interactions structur√©es et fr√©quentes avec des experts de notre organisation, et vous serez responsable de la fiabilit√© des donn√©es.¬†
Les m√©triques comprendront des indicateurs de performance cl√©s li√©s √† : (i) les activit√©s li√©es aux sinistres et les initiatives du plan d'action (productivit√©, d√©penses, √©conomies, personnel, recouvrement, fraude, service des sinistres, conformit√©‚Ä¶), (ii) les donn√©es sur les sinistres (grands sinistres (caus√©s par l'homme et Nat Cats) et sinistres attritionnels ; sinistres sensibles ; litiges ; crises (par ex. Covid19, conflit en Ukraine) et tendances (par ex. inflation)) et (iii) les op√©rations de sinistres (mesures li√©es aux processus de traitement des sinistres (par ex. d√©lai moyen de la premi√®re r√©serve) et aux flux de donn√©es sur les sinistres).¬†
Contribuer √† la conduite du changement et √† l'am√©lioration continue en mati√®re d'analyse des donn√©es.¬†
Nous pensons que notre organisation des sinistres doit √©voluer pour mieux saisir et analyser les donn√©es, √©tant donn√© que dans le cadre de notre feuille de route de transformation, nous allons (devoir) avoir acc√®s √† de plus en plus de points de donn√©es. Par cons√©quent¬†

job_description:
Job description

We are currently looking for a Data Engineer with a degree in data engineering or computer science and with 1-3 years of work experience in similar role.

As a Data Engineer in our Global Data Science and Analytics team, you will be reporting to our Lead Data Scientist and collaborate very closely with our senior data engineer, other data scientists and analysts in the team.

You will be able to deep dive into our massive player data, prototype and deploy diverse data pipelines that supports our data products to drive business value.


From the beginning of your adventure with us, you will be called to:

Build and optimize best-class data pipelines using advanced data stack
Maintain and enhance our in-house Machine learning model deployment platform written in python
Contribute the deployment of our data products to production environment
Work on efficient data solutions optimized for cross platform games
Assist in the data science process and machine learning workflow
Help improving our internal game tracking solutions.¬†
Field11:

Master‚Äôs degree / Engineering school in an IT field

Strong knowledge in Git and CI/CD pipelines
Familiarity with Airflow
Experience in cloud based data warehouses, knowledge of AWS services is a plus
Familiarity with Machine Learning algorithms, concepts and processes
Autonomous, team player and detail-oriented
Adaptability and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Good communication in English (French is not mandatory)
Passion for gaming

Desired:

Experience working with external API and build internal micro-services
Experience with Agile framework, able to use Jira and Confluence
Experience with conda package manager
Experience in process automation
Willing to play and discover our games to better understand business needs

job_description:
Job description

Contentsquare is a global digital analytics company empowering the brands you interact with every day to build better online experiences for all. Since our founding in France in 2012, we have grown to be a truly global and distributed team ‚Äì known as the CSquad ‚Äì representing more than 70 nationalities across the world.

In 2022, we raised $600M in Series F funding and were recognised as a certified Great Place to Work in France, Germany, Israel, US and UK.

What you will do:

Measurement and Reporting:

- Develop a measurement strategy for marketing campaigns

- Build reports and visualizations with marketing key metrics to help the team understand campaign effectiveness

- Conduct deep dive analysis to identify drivers of marketing performance and generate insights for future campaigns

- Should be able to quickly digest or develop a new KPI, ask the right questions, and effectively interpret and act on what it's telling you and what it's not telling you.

- Monitor marketing KPIs and explain deviations from the norm

- Deliver sophisticated analyses to senior leadership that provide thoughtful evaluation of data

- Partner with the Growth & Performance team to analyze CAC/LTV

- Proactively identify opportunities to automate reporting and data collection processes

- Collaborate with internal teams to gather benchmark data and other insights for marketing campaigns

Data Analysis:

- Use statistical tools and methods to analyze data from various sources

- Automate analysis through insightful dashboards

- Communicate findings to stakeholders in a clear and actionable manner

- Continuously monitor data quality

What you need to succeed

Qualifications:

- Bachelor's degree in a related field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or Engineering

- Experience 3+ years in Data Analysis in a Tech Company extracting insights from data to inform decision making, and a strong understanding of interplays of different acquisition marketing channels

- Fluent professional English

Technical Skills:

- Strong SQL skills, knowledge of DBT is a plus

company_description:
Who hasn‚Äôt used Notion, Airtable or Zoom at least once? SaaS applications are everywhere to make our working life easier. Easily accessible, SaaS offers employees new ways of working.

Beamy is a French company (ex-member of Future 40 of Stating F), with a team of 50 passionate individuals. We help more than 40 major players such as LVMH, Decathlon, BNP Paribas, Fnac Darty, and Engie. Our goal is to make SaaS governance a top priority for large enterprises in Europe and around the world.
job_description:
Job description

To support Beamy's growth, we are looking for a talented Data Project Manager to work on improving and/or creating operational processes within the Ops team.¬†

Indeed, in order to support our growth and onboard more and more new clients, we need to create smooth processes to manage the deployment of our software, to process our customers' data etc.

Your main missions :

- Business interviews: Being willing to understand our overall business processes and challenge them with the business owners. You should be able to detect the friction points and suggest solutions to succeed in improving those process in a smoother and more efficient manner ;

- Project Management: Alongside an experienced Ops manager, you will learn the different steps of project management and deployment within our internal organization ;

- Continuous Improvement: You will have responsibilities and autonomy recommending improvements on our internal organization, in order to save time for our customers and the Beamy team.¬†

What we offer:

- A strong path to evolve in the SaaS industry.

- No micromanagement, full ownership and strong autonomy.

- A united and highly dedicated team who's not faint-hearted.

- A key position in our organisation and the opportunity to be a fundamental player in Beamy's acceleration and international scale.

- The possibility of transforming the internship into a permanent contract at the end !

About you:

- You are in Master¬†(Engineering/Business/Strategy) and are looking for 6 months internship.

- You have an entrepreneurial spirit, very curious, ready to find solutions and take on responsibilities quickly.

- You are not afraid of technical subjects.

- You have strong organisation skills, rigorous and methodical, with excellent listening skills.

- You are very comfortable with communication, you're a French native speaker and fluent in English.

- You have a real thirst for progress and desire to learn every day. Ambition is one of your drivers.

Research shows that while men apply to jobs where they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other underrepresented groups tend to only apply when they meet 100% of the qualifications. At Beamy, we value respectful debate and people who aren't afraid to challenge assumptions, so we are looking for diverse perspectives as long as you meet our minimum criteria.

You are encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description!

company_description: Qonto is the leading European business finance solution. We energize SMEs and freelancers so that they can achieve more.
job_description:
Job description

Our mission? Creating the finance solution that energizes SMEs and freelancers, so they can achieve more. We simplify everything from everyday banking to bookkeeping and spend management. At Qonto, we‚Äôre passionate about creating the best product, so if you‚Äôre looking for an ambitious team that‚Äôs revolutionizing an old-fashioned industry, get in touch!

Our journey: Alexandre¬†and¬†Steve¬†launched Qonto in July 2017. Since then, the team has earned the trust of more than 350,000 customers and opened offices in Paris, Berlin, Milan, and Barcelona. Last summer, we joined forces with Penta, a market leader based in Berlin and Belgrade, forming a united team of 1000+ Qontoers. We also made it to the Top 3 of LinkedIn Top Startups France!

Our values:

Ambition¬†| We tackle big challenges. No matter what.

Teamwork¬†| We create momentum by working together, at the same speed.

Mastery¬†| We pursue excellence through continuous learning. We face challenges with humility. Every day.

Integrity¬†| We're open. We're honest. And we earn the trust of our clients and each other.

You can find out more about the¬†Qonto Way¬†here.

Our beliefs: Our goal at Qonto is to create a warm and welcoming environment where individuals from all walks of life can truly thrive. We've gone above and beyond to ensure that every applicant is evaluated solely based on their skills and potential, rather than their gender, ethnicity, age, (dis)ability, or any other irrelevant factor. Our team consists of 49% international individuals, with 44% women and 20% parents. With this diversity, we are a powerful force! Join us in our mission to build a workplace that celebrates diversity and embraces individuality.¬†Discover the steps we took to create a discrimination-free hiring process.

Qonto has grown a 60+ data team with Data Engineers, BI, and Data Scientists working together to¬†deliver great dashboards, reports, and data products. Now is the time for Qonto to strengthen its data foundations. Qonto is looking for its Head of Data Platform to build¬†its next-generation data platform.

Our vision of the Data platform

Your team ‚Äî data platform ‚Äî covers three key functions:¬†governance, ingestion and data modelling. You only ingest the data Qontoers need: this is data governance. You rely on a modern data stack to ingest the data: airflow, dbt and snowflake. And you craft nice and discoverable tables and fields to be used widely at Qonto: this is data modelling. You serve¬†all data teams: BI, Data Science, and Data Products.

You can count on your Lead Data Engineering for the data governance and ingestion part and on your Lead Analytics Engineering for the data modelling part.

üë©‚Äçüíªüßë‚ÄçüíªWhat you will achieve in this role in your first year

- Master governance and ingestion: is the data your team ingest well documented? is it tested?

- Simplify the data model: we now have clean data: that‚Äôs great! After ingestion it‚Äôs still very raw: how do you make it useful?

- Take accountability for your team delivery: how many incidents did you have last month? how severe were they?

- Hire and scale¬†your team of 12

- Coach and Grow your team: you will train both Leads (data eng + AE) so that they can in turn train their own team. And everyone will be set for success!

- Make your team shine inside and outside Qonto: you ingest clean data, transform them into nice documented tables, self-discoverable by every Qontoers. What a success! The incidents have nearly vanished and you feel proud of your team. How about you spread the word and share the key ingredients of your success?

üõ† Tech Stack:

Our primary language is Python, our core platform consists of a Snowflake data warehouse, fueled primarily by an on site Airflow instance running on a Kubernetes cluster. Data is centralized through custom orchestrated batch jobs, with S3 as our intermediary lake. Data modelization is enabled thanks to an orchestrated dbt repository and quality validation results of a mix of tests using Great Expectations and dbt. We took advantage of ELK for logging and monitoring as well as Airflow‚Äôs internal database.

ü§î What you can expect

- Join Qonto who is¬†winning SME banking in Europe. Qonto is on track to power one million SMEs in 2025.

- Develop dozens of customer-impacting innovative data products ranging from understanding better our clients, to Qonto app killer features

- Work with a top-notch team

- Leverage our values and our culture¬†of continuous improvement to boost your impact as a leader

ü§ù Your future Manager

J√©r√©mie, VP of Data, will be the one to help you succeed

- His background?

Before joining Qonto, J√©r√©mie was an associate professor at Telecom Paris and Telecom SudParis. He¬†led data teams for some of France's most reputed digital companies and still advises several deep tech startups. He teaches at Ecole Polytechnique and co-authored over 50 scientific papers.

- What does he bring to the team?

J√©r√©mie defines a clear vision and path to success for our data platform, BI, data science analytics, and data products teams. He ensures they operate efficiently and have a smooth¬†collaboration with other departments at Qonto. He also helps them continuously learn new skills while improving their existing ones and is still very involved in the hiring of his teams.

üèÖAbout You

Management: You have strong experience in¬†managing¬†Data engineer's teams and it's a plus if you have managed Analytics engineer's teams¬†

Mastery: You are familiar with data pipeline tools (airflow, dbt, etc.), modern data architectures, and data governance processes

Simplicity and quality: You prefer simple solutions and are obsessed with quality

Languages:¬†You are fluent in English. French is a plus.

At Qonto we understand that true diversity isn't just about ticking boxes on a hiring checklist. Apply regardless of the boxes you tick! Who knows? You may have the missing piece of the puzzle we've been searching for all along.

üéÅ Perks

A laptop. An inclusive work environment. A tailor-made career track. And so much more to help you succeed.

- A central fully-renovated building in Paris with¬†WeWork¬†services

- Monthly team events

- Tailor-made remote work policy depending on the job you apply for

- 25 days of paid leave + 5 Qonto days or 25 days of paid leave + 10 RTT +/-

- Alan health insurance, Moka Care to take care of your mental health, and Gymlib for sports and wellness activities

- A Swile¬†lunch card: 50% covered

- A progressive parenthood policy as part of our commitment to the¬†Parental Act (1 in 6 of Qonto employees is a parent!) and childcare benefits with selected partners

üí™ Our hiring process:

- Interviews with your Talent Acquisition Manager and future managers

- A remote exercise to demonstrate your skills and give you a taste of what working at Qonto could be like

We will send you an interview guide so you can best prepare yourself.

On average our process lasts 20 working days and offers usually follow within 48 hours ü§û

Thank you for considering joining Qonto. We cannot wait to learn more about you!

One last thing. We recently raised 486M‚Ç¨ in our Series D to ensure we keep growing safely, despite the current economic environment looking a bit gloomy. We revealed our plans for the future here.

To learn more about us:

Qonto's Blog¬†|¬†Les √âchos I Challenges |¬†Forbes
